Un juego que ha sufrido un monton de cambios durante sus años de vida. Obviamente, Cualquier juego podra cambiar mucho durante los años, Pero la diferencia que hizo este para multijugador. Una cosa que es segun como tu lo veas, Siendo mayormente algo negativa. Lo recomiendo para divertirse con risas y sustos cuando estas con amigos, Personalizada con un amigo killer y otros survivor. La experiencia en solitario como killer o survivor puede ser segun tu suerte, Por lo que recomendar este juego es solo si realmente quieres probar este juego. (Tomen en cuenta que apenas tomes perk de killer muy buenas y tomes experiencia para atrapar gente, Siempre ganaras, Incluso si es endgame. Jugar como survivor tendras que tener mucha suerte, Y incluso otra suerte para conseguir perk que apenas ya sirven con todo el nerf existente.)

After spending years playing this game and putting in around 2.5K hours, I've seen the health of the game fluctuate drastically, mostly on the unhealthy side. There is one deciding factor on what makes a game great and not, and that is the developers. Time and time again, Behaviour has shown that they do not care about the health of the playerbase, the health of the game, nor the health of their servers. Behaviour uses Amazon servers to host their games, and they are very unstable and constantly lag. Unlike other games like FPS games, where the hitboxes are all calculated together, Behaviour's servers always prioritize and calculate the killer's actions first; be prepared to get hit when you shouldn't be hit. Due to their recent patch where they changed a lot of the mechanics of the game, they swayed the game heavily into the killer's favor leaving little to zero a survivor can do to prevent tunneling or camping. The fact that the developers do not ademently play the game themselves, nor take on a collective mind of respected members of the game's community to discuss healthy decisions for the game, the game has slowly gone downhill over the course of the last 3 years in particular. The developers have zero clue as to how to manage the game, how to code the game, what decisions are best for the health of the game and it's community......It's a very sad situation. It's been shown that all they care about is money. For years they've devoted more resources to cosmetics than fixing the bugs and cheats in their game. As long as ppl still bought cosmetics, who really cares if they fix their game, right? So, along came Evil Dead which really pushed Behaviour into actually trying to make an effort, but again, they haven't a clue what they are really doing. The match making doesn't work, the ingame chat is censored despite being an 18+ only game. It's probably better to just find a new game genre to try something new, not this game.

This game had so much potential but lacked so much immersion and game play. First for starters you have no way to defend yourself besides running and knocking over pallets. Most of the players that are the killers tend to camp near the objectives, so this makes it impossible to win since you cannot fight back. If you are looking for a game similar with much more choices and strategies choose FRIDAY THE 13TH Game.

This game is super fun to grind away at and play with friends, I love the licenced content and I would choose this game over all of the other cat vs mouse type games.

However the new update, (although some of it was needed) I find the new generator slow down was very unnecessary, and other nerfs as well makes survivor game play painful most of the time instead of some of the time. It does make killer game play just a little easier but depending how other people play the game it becomes super unbalanced (well, it has always had an imbalance). It makes only half the game fun depending on who you end up playing with, and is super difficult to combat toxic game play.
after the update, its just too one-sided. could not recommend to anyone, any advantage survivors had is not entirely gone.

Since the new patch it's just not fun to play anymore: Stupidly difficult to escape as survivor with killers tunneling, bodyblocking, etc. like crazy and it being boringly easy to play as killer now. I get the effect they were going for and making the experience all "spooky" and "more like an actual horror movie" but now it just feels SO one-sided it's just not fun to play the other side now.

If you want your sanity to remain intact then I don't recommend this game at ALL now, atleast not til some of these stupid and baffling changes are either adjusted or reverted back to what they were.

At this point, I've got over 2k hours in this game and have played for like...4 years? Let's just say I remember when Legion was released as the new killer.

I've played killer and I've played survivor. Both are stressful in their own ways, but killer is you against 4 others and if you're against survivors with even a partial brain, it's going to be rough. Killer is a lot of time management and keeping pressure and certain killers are just worse at that than others. Killer is fun, but expect to get lots of clicky flashlights and t-bagging while you're learning and a lot of complaining when you start to get better.

Survivor play is calmer, generally, but solo-queue is rough. Teammates are braindead, disconnect, and generally you should play to save your own skin. Learning to loop, learning maps, and learning when to stay put are all key parts of learning and you need to always be doing something as a survivor. You are not going to live every match and no, the killer doesn't have to show mercy just because your teammates DC'd.

In the end? Play how you want to play. You're going to get frustrated on either side, but both sides offer unique challenges and can be fun if you just play how you want.
